name: Innocent Criminals (Posheem Hapim me Peshaa)
description: One of the first direct political songs written by Tamer Nafar in the context of the Second Intifada.

name: Tamer Must Vote
description: Encouraged Arab citizens of Israel to participate in elections to combat right-wing politics.

name: The Beat Never Goes Off
description: Tamer Nafar raps in front of the separation wall, touching on occupation and Palestinian spirit.

name: Rock it like a Palestinian
description: Recent single by Tamer Nafar highlighting identity.

name: Bo Nedaber Dugri (Let's Talk Straight)
description: Viral hit by Saz and Uriya Rosenman tackling the Jewish-Arab narrative conflict head-on.

name: Hymn of the Warrior (Hamnon Halochem)
description: Tribute to IDF combat soldiers, filming at Bahad 1.

name: Super Heroes (Giborei Al)
description: Tribute to IDF reservists following Oct 7, highlighting civilians turning into soldiers.

name: Most Israeli (Hachi Yisraeli)
description: Explores facets of Israeli identity and national pride.

name: Moledet
description: Dedicated to Israel after Oct 7, expressing desire to rebuild and resilience.

name: Nigun HaNeshamot
description: Written during the Second Lebanon War, revisited in later conflicts.

name: Am Yisrael Chai
description: Anthem released after Oct 7 symbolizing unity and resilience.

name: Al Kufiyyeh 3arabeyyeh (The Kufiya is Arab)
description: Seminal track emphasizing the keffiyeh as a symbol of Palestinian identity.

name: Kulun 'Andun Dababat (They All Have Tanks)
description: Delves into Palestinian internal politics and resistance.

name: Somos Sur
description: Collaboration with Ana Tijoux, speaking to the global resistance movement.
